intro: Clidemia ulei, commonly known as Hawaiian snowberry, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and is often found growing in moist, shaded areas. It produces small, round berries that are edible but not particularly flavorful. Clidemia ulei plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing food for various birds and insects.
